intro: Dockrillia banksii, commonly known as the Banks' dockrillia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. It produces showy, yellow flowers that are clustered in terminal inflorescences. Dockrillia banksii is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
